verifyHostname.description:
if the server is using self-signed certificate, this need to be false. If true, you have to use CA signed certificate or load
truststore that contains the self-signed certificate.

loadDefaultTrustStore.description: indicate of system load default cert.

loadTrustStore.description: trust store contains certificates that server needs. Enable if tls is used.

trustStore.description: trust store location can be specified here or system properties javax.net.ssl.trustStore and password javax.net.ssl.trustStorePassword

loadKeyStore.description: key store contains client key and it should be loaded if two-way ssl is used.

tlsVersion.description:
TLS version. Default is TSLv1.3, and you can downgrade to TLSv1.2 to support some internal old servers that support only TLSv1.1
and 1.2 (deprecated and risky).

multipleAuthServers.description:
OAuth 2.0 token endpoint configuration
If there are multiple oauth providers per serviceId, then we need to update this flag to true. In order to derive the serviceId from the
path prefix, we need to set up the pathPrefixServices below if there is no duplicated paths between services.

capacity.description: Capacity of caching tokens in the client for downstream API calls. The default value is 200.

tokenRenewBeforeExpired.description: The scope token will be renewed automatically 1 minute before expiry

expiredRefreshRetryDelay.description: if scope token is expired, we need short delay so that we can retry faster.

earlyRefreshRetryDelay.description: if scope token is not expired but in renew window, we need slow retry delay.

server_url.description:
token server url. The default port number for token service is 6882. If this is set,
it will take high priority than serviceId for the direct connection

serviceId.description:
token service unique id for OAuth 2.0 provider. If server_url is not set above,
a service discovery action will be taken to find an instance of token service.

proxyHost.description:
For users who leverage SaaS OAuth 2.0 provider from lightapi.net or others in the public cloud
and has an internal proxy server to access code, token and key services of OAuth 2.0, set up the
proxyHost here for the HTTPS traffic. This option is only working with server_url and serviceId
below should be commented out. OAuth 2.0 services cannot be discovered if a proxy server is used.

proxyPort.description:
We only support HTTPS traffic for the proxy and the default port is 443. If your proxy server has
a different port, please specify it here. If proxyHost is available and proxyPort is missing, then
the default value 443 is going to be used for the HTTP connection.

enableHttp2.description: set to true if the oauth2 provider supports HTTP/2

authorization_code.description: the following section defines uri and parameters for authorization code grant type

uri.description: token endpoint for authorization code grant

client_id.description: client_id for authorization code grant flow.

client_secret.description: client_secret for authorization code grant flow.

redirect_uri.description: the web server uri that will receive the redirected authorization code

scope.description:
optional scope, default scope in the client registration will be used if not defined.
If there are scopes specified here, they will be verified against the registered scopes.
In values.yml, you define a list of strings for the scope(s).
- petstore.r
- petstore.w

client_credentials.description: the following section defines uri and parameters for client credentials grant type

uri.description: token endpoint for client credentials grant

client_id.description: client_id for client credentials grant flow.

client_secret.description: client_secret for client credentials grant flow.

scope.description:
optional scope, default scope in the client registration will be used if not defined.
If there are scopes specified here, they will be verified against the registered scopes.
In values.yml, you define a list of strings for the scope(s).
- petstore.r
- petstore.w

serviceIdAuthServers.description:
The serviceId to the service specific OAuth 2.0 configuration. Used only when multipleOAuthServer is
set as true. For detailed config options, please see the values.yml in the client module test.

uri.description: token endpoint for refresh token grant

client_id.description: client_id for refresh token grant flow.

client_secret.description: client_secret for refresh token grant flow

scope.description:
optional scope, default scope in the client registration will be used if not defined.
If there are scopes specified here, they will be verified against the registered scopes.
In values.yml, you define a list of strings for the scope(s).
- petstore.r

uri.description: token endpoint for token exchange grant type

scope.description:
optional scope, default scope in the client registration will be used if not defined.

subjectToken.description: subject token the identity of the party on behalf of whom the request is being made

subjectTokenType.description:
Subject token type the type of the subject token. The default value 'urn:ietf:params:oauth:token-type:jwt'
is chosen because it represents a JWT token type as defined in the OAuth 2.0 specification.

key.description: light-oauth2 key distribution endpoint configuration for token verification

server_url.description:
key distribution server url for token verification. It will be used if it is configured.
If it is not set, a service lookup will be taken with serviceId to find an instance.

serviceId.description: key serviceId for key distribution service, it will be used if above server_url is not configured.

uri.description: the path for the key distribution endpoint

client_id.description: client_id used to access key distribution service. It can be the same client_id with token service or not.

client_secret.description: client secret used to access the key distribution service.

enableHttp2.description: set to true if the oauth2 provider supports HTTP/2

serviceIdAuthServers.description:
The serviceId to the service specific OAuth 2.0 configuration. Used only when multipleOAuthServer is
set as true. For detailed config options, please see the values.yml in the client module test.

audience.description: audience for the token validation. It is optional and if it is not configured, no audience validation will be executed.

server_url.description:
token server url. The default port number for token service is 6882. If this url exists, it will be used.
if it is not set, then a service lookup against serviceId will be taken to discover an instance.

proxyHost.description:
For users who leverage SaaS OAuth 2.0 provider from lightapi.net or others in the public cloud
and has an internal proxy server to access code, token and key services of OAuth 2.0, set up the
proxyHost here for the HTTPS traffic. This option is only working with server_url and serviceId
below should be commented out. OAuth 2.0 services cannot be discovered if a proxy server is used.

proxyPort.description:
We only support HTTPS traffic for the proxy and the default port is 443. If your proxy server has
a different port, please specify it here. If proxyHost is available and proxyPort is missing, then
the default value 443 is going to be used for the HTTP connection.

serviceId.description: token serviceId. If server_url doesn't exist, the serviceId will be used to lookup the token service.

uri.description: signing endpoint for the sign request

enableHttp2.description: set to true if the oauth2 provider supports HTTP/2

client_secret.description: client secret for client authentication and it can be encrypted here.

key.description: the key distribution sever config for sign. It can be different then token key distribution server.

server_url.description:
key distribution server url. It will be used to establish connection if it exists.
if it is not set, then a service lookup against serviceId will be taken to discover an instance.

serviceId.description: the unique service id for key distribution service, it will be used to lookup key service if above url doesn't exist.

uri.description: the path for the key distribution endpoint

client_id.description: client_id used to access key distribution service. It can be the same client_id with token service or not.

client_secret.description: client secret used to access the key distribution service.

enableHttp2.description: set to true if the oauth2 provider supports HTTP/2

audience.description: audience for the token validation. It is optional and if it is not configured, no audience validation will be executed.

deref.description: de-ref by reference token to JWT token. It is separate service as it might be the external OAuth 2.0 provider.

server_url.description:
Token service server url, this might be different than the above token server url.
The static url will be used if it is configured.

proxyHost.description:
For users who leverage SaaS OAuth 2.0 provider in the public cloud and has an internal
proxy server to access code, token and key services of OAuth 2.0, set up the proxyHost
here for the HTTPS traffic. This option is only working with server_url and serviceId
below should be commented out. OAuth 2.0 services cannot be discovered if a proxy is used.

proxyPort.description:
We only support HTTPS traffic for the proxy and the default port is 443. If your proxy server has
a different port, please specify it here. If proxyHost is available and proxyPort is missing, then
the default value 443 is going to be used for the HTTP connection.

serviceId.description: token service unique id for OAuth 2.0 provider. Need for service lookup/discovery. It will be used if above server_url is not configured.

enableHttp2.description: set to true if the oauth2 provider supports HTTP/2

uri.description: the path for the key distribution endpoint

client_id.description: client_id used to access key distribution service. It can be the same client_id with token service or not.

pathPrefixServices.description:
If you have multiple OAuth 2.0 providers and use path prefix to decide which OAuth 2.0 server
to get the token or JWK. If two or more services have the same path, you must use serviceId in
the request header to use the serviceId to find the OAuth 2.0 provider configuration.

request.description: Circuit breaker configuration for the client

errorThreshold.description: number of timeouts/errors to break the circuit

connectTimeout.description:
Timeout, in milliseconds, controlling the initial TCP connection establishment. When using the light-4j Http2Client, this value
specifies the timeout for obtaining a connection. When using the JDK 11 HttpClient wrapper, it represents the connection timeout.
The default value is 2000 ms.

timeout.description:
Timeout, in milliseconds, controlling the entire requestâ€“response exchange. When using the light-4j Http2Client, this value
represents the request timeout. When using the JDK 11 HttpClient wrapper, it also represents the request timeout. The default value is 3000 ms.

resetTimeout.description: reset the circuit after this timeout in millisecond

injectOpenTracing.description: if open tracing is enabled. traceability, correlation and metrics should not be in the chain if opentracing is used.

injectCallerId.description: inject serviceId as callerId into the http header for metrics to collect the caller. The serviceId is from server.yml

enableHttp2.description: the flag to indicate whether http/2 is enabled when calling client.callService()

connectionPoolSize.description: the maximum host capacity of connection pool

connectionExpireTime.description:
Connection expire time when connection pool is used. By default, the cached connection will be closed after 30 minutes.
This is one way to force the connection to be closed so that the client-side discovery can be balanced.

maxReqPerConn.description:
The maximum request limitation for each connection in the connection pool. By default, a connection will be closed after
sending 1 million requests. This is one way to force the client-side discovery to re-balance the connections.

maxConnectionNumPerHost.description: maximum quantity of connection in connection pool for each host

minConnectionNumPerHost.description:
minimum quantity of connection in connection pool for each host. The corresponding connection number will shrink to minConnectionNumPerHost
by remove least recently used connections when the connection number of a host reach 0.75 * maxConnectionNumPerHost.

maxRequestRetry.description: Maximum request retry times for each request. If you don't want to retry, set it to 1. The default value is 3.

requestRetryDelay.description: The delay time in milliseconds for each request retry. The default value is 1000.
